info.title: Management API v2
info.description:
# Introduction The Management API is a secure REST API that provides read and write access to your Kontent.ai projects and subscriptions. Use the Management API v2 to manage the content, content model, and configuration of your project. Subscription admins on Enterprise plans with a [Subscription API key](#section/Authentication) can also use the Management API to manage users, roles, and projects under a subscription. The base URL for all requests to the Management API is `https://manage.kontent.ai/v2`. All requests to the API must be made securely with HTTPS with [TLS 1.2](https://github.com/Kentico/delivery-sdk-net/wiki/Fixing-error:-Could-not-create-SSL-TLS-secure-channel "A note on TLS 1.1 deprecation") and [authenticated](#section/Authentication) with a valid API key. Requests to the API are [rate limited](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ea35e9bf-711d-4f2f-9da7-af79c825d55f) and uncached. ```curl curl --request GET --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v2/projects//items --header 'Authorization: Bearer ' --header 'x-continuation: ' --header 'Content-type: application/json' ```
**Need content filtering?** If you need to filter content and deliver it to your apps, we recommend using the Delivery REST API or Delivery GraphQL API.
# Authentication To work with the Management API, send your requests over HTTPS and authenticate using the `Authorization` header in the following format: `Authorization: Bearer `. ## API keys To get your API key for the Management API, go to [Kontent.ai](https://app.kontent.ai/) > Project settings > API keys. The Management API accepts two kinds of API keys, Management API key and Subscription API key. * Subscription API key * Limited to [subscription admins](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/cf01b0d0-6f59-4710-8bc5-de56a9f86070). * Provides access to the projects and subscriptions the admin has access to. * Can be used with all Management API endpoints. * Management API key * Limited to users with the [Manage APIs permission](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/1470ff99-76cc-4071-ae9b-8ae363ee5dd5). * Provides access to a single Kontent.ai project. You will need a different Management API key for each of your projects. * Can be used with Management API endpoints that get or modify objects in a single project.

a0915b97_a0c4_018c_1f8a_3e1fe3860752.title: external_id
a0915b97_a0c4_018c_1f8a_3e1fe3860752.description: [External ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) of the language. Only present if defined when creating the language.

a0c69aac_2c3b_01b0_14cf_1deba53271df.title: archived_step
a0c69aac_2c3b_01b0_14cf_1deba53271df.description: The workflow's predefined Archived workflow step.

a11ddef2_073f_010c_1749_9765f8935df6.title: codename
a11ddef2_073f_010c_1749_9765f8935df6.description: The content type snippet's codename. Unless set while [creating the content type snippet](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/eed2653e-fdff-4d30-89ea-0815929f09be), it is [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the snippet's `name` and can later be [modified](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/42d0ac5b-7a4e-45f3-b681-a1ca12b54574).

a3d6b5ce_e65a_0108_757b_b1106fa46787.title: archived_step
a3d6b5ce_e65a_0108_757b_b1106fa46787.description: The workflow's predefined Archived workflow step.

a5241d37_1549_0156_27d7_9f259d30d88b.title: role_ids
a5241d37_1549_0156_27d7_9f259d30d88b.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can restore archived content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can restore archived content items.

a5443d5b_1d9d_0183_ac26_0693e7fe0439.title: collection_groups
a5443d5b_1d9d_0183_ac26_0693e7fe0439.description:
Specifies the permissions the user has in the project based on the user's [role](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) and access to specific [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/672a109a-bf6c-4498-a244-1b9263682e09) and [languages](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007).

You can assign the user specific roles in different collections. At least one collection group must be specified.

a5e8fb68_038a_0111_225b_201408613d14.title: value
a5e8fb68_038a_0111_225b_201408613d14.description:
The value of taxonomy elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects. Each reference represents a taxonomy term of a specific taxonomy group. Every taxonomy term can be referenced only once.

When retrieving taxonomy elements, the Management API will always reference taxonomy terms with their internal IDs. When updating taxonomy elements via the API, you can reference a taxonomy term by its internal ID, external ID, or codename.

a5f8e2d5_472f_01db_9a95_d95cd3088af4.title: is_required
a5f8e2d5_472f_01db_9a95_d95cd3088af4.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

a6057ab5_b369_01ec_b128_a266b29e0999.title: external_id
a6057ab5_b369_01ec_b128_a266b29e0999.description: The content type snippet's external ID. Only present if defined when [adding the snippet](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/eed2653e-fdff-4d30-89ea-0815929f09be).

a61b5778_6f2e_016f_0992_cfed849acc6f.title: image_height_limit
a61b5778_6f2e_016f_0992_cfed849acc6f.description: Specifies the height limitation for the asset.

a65bb352_6109_0115_1291_c9e3702ce072.title: value
a65bb352_6109_0115_1291_c9e3702ce072.description:
The element's value. * When upserting the element with the `mode` set to `autogenerated`, the `value` is ignored and can be omitted. * If the value is upserted, the element's mode changes to `custom` automatically.
**Automatic vs. manual mode** The URL slug element can function in two modes, automatic and manual. When creating language variants in automatic mode, the system automatically generates the element's value based on the text element of your choice. If you modify the element's value directly (either in UI or via API), the element switches to the manual mode. In this mode, the element does not react to changes made to the dependent text element. Learn about creating SEO-friendly URLs in your projects.

a698aafe_0c99_01de_07cc_2255f74dac82.title: guidelines
a698aafe_0c99_01de_07cc_2255f74dac82.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

a79608e3_841e_019d_b542_e5e5e19d3f77.title: last_modified
a79608e3_841e_019d_b542_e5e5e19d3f77.description:
The [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last change to the content item.
Moving content items through workflow doesn't affect the `last_modified` value.

a7ae4547_3914_018a_d0a5_14d7abc45509.title: role_ids
a7ae4547_3914_018a_d0a5_14d7abc45509.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can restore archived content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can restore archived content items.

a879abf8_7097_01c3_08f1_193dd87401ad.title: property_name
a879abf8_7097_01c3_08f1_193dd87401ad.description:
Specifies the property of the taxonomy group or term that you want to replace.

The value of {~property_name~} can be one of the following:

* Use {~codename~} to change the codename of the group or terms.
* Use {~name~} to change the name of the group or terms.
* Use {~terms~} to change the descendant taxonomy terms of the group of term.

a885c49a_9eba_01a7_3fa1_64b546d86a3f.title: path
a885c49a_9eba_01a7_3fa1_64b546d86a3f.description:
A string identifying the property that should be replaced. The exact path depends on what you are trying to replace. If you need to add a property to an object, specify a `{path_reference}` for that object.

* To change the content type's name, set `path` to: `/name`.
* To change the content type's codename, set `path` to: `/codename`.
* To change the name of a content group, set `path` to: `/content_groups/{path_reference}/name`.
* To change a given property of an element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/{property_name}`, where the available values for `{property_name}` will depend on the specific element you are referencing.
* To change a property of a multiple choice option, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}/{property_name}`, where the first `{path_reference}` is to the multiple choice element, the second `{path_reference}` is to the option you want to modify, and the `{property_name}` value will be either `name` or `codename`. See [multiple choice element structure](#section/Multiple-choice-element-in-type) for details.

For all elements (including multiple choice options), you can specify the properties to be modified based on the [element type](#tag/Elements-in-content-types). You cannot modify the `external_id`, `id`, or `type` of the elements. It is also not possible to replace individual values for an object (such as the value of a limitation object) – you need to replace the entire object at once. You also cannot replace the allowed blocks for rich text elements; you need to add or remove the blocks one by one.

a8b0965a_305a_011e_00c5_e5b66a61e2b0.title: codename
a8b0965a_305a_011e_00c5_e5b66a61e2b0.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

aa16ab97_b3b0_01a6_fd89_ad6361f6a79f.title: is_user_active
aa16ab97_b3b0_01a6_fd89_ad6361f6a79f.description: A flag determining whether the user is active in this environment.

aa98028f_b89e_0153_659c_ba5bdbb18a8c.title: allowed_table_formatting
aa98028f_b89e_0153_659c_ba5bdbb18a8c.description:
Specifies which text formatting is allowed inside tables in your rich text element. To allow all formatting, leave the array empty. To allow only plaintext, use `["unstyled"]`.
The `unstyled` value must precede any other values in the list.

ab5d5881_53bc_019e_c442_8ccc82e7de1d.title: codename
ab5d5881_53bc_019e_c442_8ccc82e7de1d.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

ac9d7154_977d_0175_4cc5_2bd5faa5a839.title: external_id
ac9d7154_977d_0175_4cc5_2bd5faa5a839.description:
The taxonomy group's [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e).
Only present if specified when creating the taxonomy group via API.

acaa301d_2260_01a2_8a55_e68454db0095.title: scheduled_to
acaa301d_2260_01a2_8a55_e68454db0095.description:
[ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date-time for scheduled unpublishing.

If omitted, the specified variant is unpublished immediately.

ad441f97_b5d3_019d_4c2a_4a53f7691353.title: content_group
ad441f97_b5d3_019d_4c2a_4a53f7691353.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

ad77dfd7_a52b_01de_d675_7b82c8af5d59.title: is_required
ad77dfd7_a52b_01de_d675_7b82c8af5d59.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

af557147_79d4_0140_d78f_bc49c7b28906.title: custom_width
af557147_79d4_0140_d78f_bc49c7b28906.description:
The output image's width in pixels. Must be smaller than `width`.

Use `custom_width` if you want to resize the rectangle region selected via `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height`. That is to keep the contents of the selected rectangle region but make the output image smaller.

af6945c7_a554_0102_6f30_8ea74406a5a4.title: op
af6945c7_a554_0102_6f30_8ea74406a5a4.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `addInto` to add new folders
* `remove` to delete folders
* `rename` to rename folders

asset_description.title: Asset description
asset_description.description: An asset description defines a description of an asset for a single [language](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007).

b0e9c145_50d0_01a3_2338_bacb97783714.title: regex
b0e9c145_50d0_01a3_2338_bacb97783714.description:
The regular expression used for validation.

Examples:

* Email address: `^(?:[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+(?:.[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+)*|"(?:[x01-x08x0bx0cx0e-x1fx21x23-x5bx5d-x7f]|[x01-x09x0bx0cx0e-x7f])*")@(?:(?:[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?.)+[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?|[(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?).){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?|[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9]:(?:[x01-x08x0bx0cx0e-x1fx21-x5ax53-x7f]|[x01-x09x0bx0cx0e-x7f])+)])$`
* US phone number: `^(+1[s.-]?)?(?d{3})?[s.-]?d{3}[s.-]?d{4}$`
* Web URL: `^(https?://(?:www.|(?!www)))?[a-z0-9]+([-.]{1}[a-z0-9]+).[a-z]{2,5}(:[0-9]{1,5})?(/S)?$`

Certain formats like JSON require the regex pattern to be in escaped form. See the [MDN regex guide](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Regular%5FExpressions) for details on regular expressions.

b1509dd4_6613_019f_d0e1_772946832064.title: content_group
b1509dd4_6613_019f_d0e1_772946832064.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

b1c07e36_59bc_01c8_43b1_7e45b9b652e4.title: is_non_localizable
b1c07e36_59bc_01c8_43b1_7e45b9b652e4.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

b613c9a4_d4c7_0105_f740_eb5bdf3896f2.title: path
b613c9a4_d4c7_0105_f740_eb5bdf3896f2.description:
A string identifying what property should be replaced. The exact path depends on what you are trying to replace. If you are trying to add a property to a given object, a {~{path_reference}~} is needed for that object.

* To change the content type snippet's name, set {~path~} to: {~/name~}.
* To change the content type snippet's codename, set {~path~} to: {~/codename~}.
* To change a given property of an element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/{property_name}~}, where the available values for {~property_name~} will depend on the specific element you are referencing.
* To change a property of a multiple choice option, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the multiple choice element and the second is to the option you want to modify.

For all elements (including multiple choice options), you can specify the properties to be modified based on the [element type](#tag/Elements-in-content-types). You cannot modify the `external_id`, `id`, or `type` of the elements. It is also not possible to replace individual values for an object (such as the value of a limitation object) – you need to replace the entire object at once. You also cannot replace the allowed blocks for rich text elements; you need to add or remove the blocks one by one.

For content type snippets, you cannot modify content type snippet or URL slug elements.

b61d7a7e_495a_010e_c321_688629cdf9f2.title: codename
b61d7a7e_495a_010e_c321_688629cdf9f2.description:
The element's codename. [Initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the snippet's `name`.

When [modifying content types](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/7a70c9c4-9138-4a31-9a20-488789018b23), you can reference snippet elements by their codename provided the element already exists before making the request.

b7025521_dcd0_013d_bf00_020e01f67f56.title: guidelines
b7025521_dcd0_013d_bf00_020e01f67f56.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

b74a8fe1_245b_01c9_5559_616575935989.title: sitemap_locations
b74a8fe1_245b_01c9_5559_616575935989.description: One or more references to sitemap locations.

b79a5037_d94a_01be_bd43_2c3ad345b637.title: is_required
b79a5037_d94a_01be_bd43_2c3ad345b637.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

b98c91c9_7d01_01e5_1183_9c30c57716db.title: after
b98c91c9_7d01_01e5_1183_9c30c57716db.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the existing collection after which you want to add the new collection.

**Note**: The `before` and `after` properties are mutually exclusive.

b98f7722_efea_0141_1be6_d6bac146984d.title: is_active
b98f7722_efea_0141_1be6_d6bac146984d.description: A flag determining whether the language is active.

bafc5767_8730_013b_2332_ff31fa255364.title: collection
bafc5767_8730_013b_2332_ff31fa255364.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the item's [collection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/56b1ed90-6558-4945-8a57-34b6ecd5a5ea). Unless set while [creating the content item](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b65b450a-9c53-432b-a157-9623c951bd7a), the property references the default collection and can later be [modified](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/43503441-2aa0-471a-8e70-6ca3b29b39a8).
The default collection will always have the ID of `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000`.

bb9e82b3_a95f_0171_bf3a_42e338b51e0c.title: reference
bb9e82b3_a95f_0171_bf3a_42e338b51e0c.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to existing taxonomy terms you want to modify.

Not required if you want to modify the taxonomy group specified in the {~taxonomy_group_identifier~}.

bbea4796_8ec1_01d2_fed6_66fdea76831a.title: codename
bbea4796_8ec1_01d2_fed6_66fdea76831a.description: The collection's codename. Unless set while [creating the collection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/c9886615-cf58-4e69-86bc-beca7054d650), it is [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the collection's `name` and can later be modified.

bdfaa8f1_1b01_01da_dfbc_6ecdeaa0fd50.title: value
bdfaa8f1_1b01_01da_dfbc_6ecdeaa0fd50.description: The value to insert into the property specified in {~path~} where the format depends on the specific property.

be65f80f_1066_0105_1963_5ef0339789c8.title: name
be65f80f_1066_0105_1963_5ef0339789c8.description: The Archived workflow step's display name.

c0c326bd_a443_0111_be40_4795faf0f4e8.title: codename
c0c326bd_a443_0111_be40_4795faf0f4e8.description: The taxonomy term's codename. Unless you set it (such as while [creating a taxonomy group](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/98d52aed-510e-4da1-ab72-33ba97a574e2)), it is initially generated from the term's `name` and can later be [modified](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/cb2a6c42-7a7c-4ca2-94a7-0faf443ddb59).

c2438324_eea4_01aa_cf0b_0923eb120085.title: is_non_localizable
c2438324_eea4_01aa_cf0b_0923eb120085.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

c29b2303_dc21_01f6_b8b4_53be22dc3067.title: taxonomy_group
c29b2303_dc21_01f6_b8b4_53be22dc3067.description: Specifies a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the taxonomy group that the element uses.

c332a46a_bb65_01af_f6ce_37dbd7b111f5.title: is_non_localizable
c332a46a_bb65_01af_f6ce_37dbd7b111f5.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages. Custom elements cannot be set as non-localizable.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

c384cc9b_f673_01a9_0c93_a945382af1e3.title: global
c384cc9b_f673_01a9_0c93_a945382af1e3.description: Specifies a default value used as the element's initial value across all languages.

c3a6e8a6_c1cf_01a6_2ffa_912a5f9746dd.title: message
c3a6e8a6_c1cf_01a6_2ffa_912a5f9746dd.description: The error message explaining what caused the error.
examples: The requested content item 'sample_item' was not found.

c588bf8d_24c0_01df_25fb_2b6dc12011e1.title: after
c588bf8d_24c0_01df_25fb_2b6dc12011e1.description:
An _optional_ [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the taxonomy term after which you want to add the new taxonomy term.

For example, to add a term after an existing "Categories" term , you can set {~after~} to {~{codename: categories}~}.

**Note**: The {~before~} and {~after~} properties are mutually exclusive.

c64dccca_1da5_0145_d8a8_50ca9d45c6e8.title: content_group
c64dccca_1da5_0145_d8a8_50ca9d45c6e8.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

c7f28913_96af_0123_e481_8a3f0b9836d2.title: path
c7f28913_96af_0123_e481_8a3f0b9836d2.description:
A string identifying where the new object or property should be added. The exact path depends on what you are trying to add and where. If you are trying to add a property to a given element, a `{path_reference}` is needed for that element.

1. To add a new element, set `path` to: `/elements`.
2. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types`.
3. To add an allowed element to a custom element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_elements`.
4. To add a new multiple choice option, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/options`.

c9541ff3_7e8f_013a_8eda_5cf88aa9f3ab.title: is_required
c9541ff3_7e8f_013a_8eda_5cf88aa9f3ab.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

ca7d7b1d_a303_01eb_0e0a_ab348e31584d.title: last_activity_at
ca7d7b1d_a303_01eb_0e0a_ab348e31584d.description: Returns the timestamp of the last user's activity in the environment.

cabfb511_e2ed_01aa_67d4_528e6d1e4f90.title: json_parameters
cabfb511_e2ed_01aa_67d4_528e6d1e4f90.description:
Optional parameters that allow you to use the element in different content types or provide customizable layout.

The value must be valid a stringified JSON.

cb974165_93d2_0171_f9f6_59a503362a23.title: asset_id
cb974165_93d2_0171_f9f6_59a503362a23.description: The id of the asset this rendition belongs to.

cc89888f_946e_019f_9f15_7ad4297339a3.title: content_group
cc89888f_946e_019f_9f15_7ad4297339a3.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

ccd07c4e_341d_01b5_9e99_9da4e6df05ff.title: value
ccd07c4e_341d_01b5_9e99_9da4e6df05ff.description: Specifies [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to taxonomy terms to be used as the element's default value.

cd56efda_361f_0174_97d2_d6dddc42100c.title: unpublish_role_ids
cd56efda_361f_0174_97d2_d6dddc42100c.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can [unpublish and archive](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f64599e8-6179-4456-a77c-6716c2e3864b) content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can unpublish and archive content items.

cdb80f66_733c_019c_fe9f_e819eb8f5394.title: op
cdb80f66_733c_019c_fe9f_e819eb8f5394.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `addInto` to add new folders
* `remove` to delete folders
* `rename` to rename folders

ce09646f_f80b_01d2_37eb_3e0f95964fde.title: applies_to
ce09646f_f80b_01d2_37eb_3e0f95964fde.description: Determines whether the value applies to characters or words.

ce4c38c0_b9a9_011e_3161_ffa9455045f1.title: collection_groups
ce4c38c0_b9a9_011e_3161_ffa9455045f1.description: Specifies the permissions the user has in the project based on the user's [role](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) and access to specific [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/672a109a-bf6c-4498-a244-1b9263682e09) and [languages](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007).

ce80f091_a2b8_01a5_0d4b_cde98e3c1bc0.title: transitions_to
ce80f091_a2b8_01a5_0d4b_cde98e3c1bc0.description: [References](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the workflow steps that this step can transition to. Workflow steps can be referenced either by their codename or internal ID.

cef98011_613f_01dd_40ae_081509ba5819.title: id
cef98011_613f_01dd_40ae_081509ba5819.description:
The language's internal ID.
The ID of the default language is always `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000`.

cefe176f_84a7_0161_28ff_5bd99ad78c7c.title: content_group
cefe176f_84a7_0161_28ff_5bd99ad78c7c.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

cff39b87_0145_016a_1b81_86bcdfefe6bb.title: element
cff39b87_0145_016a_1b81_86bcdfefe6bb.description: The dependent text element specified as a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e).

content_type_snippet_element_in_type.title: Snippet element in type
content_type_snippet_element_in_type.description:
The content type snippet elements contain the `snippet` property with a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to a specific content type snippet.

Learn more about [reusing collections of elements](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03f09b0c-682e-4a17-b090-36ca21f0ebef) with snippets.

custom_element_in_type.title: Custom element in type
custom_element_in_type.description: Custom elements contain the additional properties `source_url`, `json_parameters`, and `allowed_elements`.

examples.Error: Invalid json. Content item codename: 'custom_element_in_type'. Content item name: 'Custom type element'

d0e0a1a1_4b83_01d4_b9fb_a04f5e3730af.title: projects
d0e0a1a1_4b83_01d4_b9fb_a04f5e3730af.description: The projects to which the user has been invited.

d11a5c52_13c3_0139_30d4_15b706e71015.title: codename
d11a5c52_13c3_0139_30d4_15b706e71015.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

d1b4a8c5_25fe_01a4_f0ce_2fb2963f6407.title: scheduled_to
d1b4a8c5_25fe_01a4_f0ce_2fb2963f6407.description:
[ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date-time for scheduled publishing.

If omitted, the specified variant is published immediately.

d45dba80_635e_01fc_febf_ad0696fe87a2.title: transitions_to
d45dba80_635e_01fc_febf_ad0696fe87a2.description: A collection of references to the [workflow steps](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/8f4b37fe-f7d8-4220-af39-8081e1dc0990) that will trigger the webhook when an item transitions to them. Workflow steps must be referenced by their internal IDs.

d4b536fa_31bd_01bc_41c7_59dc48b8b351.title: snippet
d4b536fa_31bd_01bc_41c7_59dc48b8b351.description:
The content type snippet, specified as a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e), that contains the dependent text element.

**Note**: The {~snippet~} property is not present if the text element is in the same content type.

d65e1a06_7614_016e_54ef_09a02a12a880.title: property_name
d65e1a06_7614_016e_54ef_09a02a12a880.description:
Specifies the property of the collection that you want to replace.

Use `name` to change the name of the collection. Changes of other properties are currently not supported.

d86bff12_a929_0110_9c19_653b1caa4d76.title: content_group
d86bff12_a929_0110_9c19_653b1caa4d76.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

d881b749_63e9_0103_349f_b08d6d4644d1.title: codename
d881b749_63e9_0103_349f_b08d6d4644d1.description: The content type's codename. Unless set while [creating the content type](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b588f328-d335-46ce-9a16-28c56c9168f1), it is [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the type's `name` and can later be [modified](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/7a70c9c4-9138-4a31-9a20-488789018b23).

d929ed91_d2cb_01c0_3d5a_e4fe5eff9739.title: last_modified
d929ed91_d2cb_01c0_3d5a_e4fe5eff9739.description: The [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last change to content collections. This property can be `null` if the collections were not changed yet.

d9d2ca1a_6cee_01b8_406d_65fbc97beee6.title: last_modified
d9d2ca1a_6cee_01b8_406d_65fbc97beee6.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date/time of the last change to the webhook.

d9ddc768_391f_01f9_0807_22b66637106d.title: content_group
d9ddc768_391f_01f9_0807_22b66637106d.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content group the element is used in.
The `content_group` property is only present if one or more content groups are defined in the content type.

db88862b_a974_01a8_ff99_49e322faff52.title: folder
db88862b_a974_01a8_ff99_49e322faff52.description:
A [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the folder containing the asset. You can specify a folder by its internal ID or external ID. Not present if the asset is not in a folder.

To return an asset to the top level outside any folders, use `"id" : "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"`.

dc75e32a_a522_01bf_90ae_e2013b18872b.title: before
dc75e32a_a522_01bf_90ae_e2013b18872b.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the existing collection before which you want to place the collection specified by `reference` property.

**Note**: The `before` and `after` properties are mutually exclusive.

dea0777c_a81a_015a_bec5_0cba4a3c0b84.title: id
dea0777c_a81a_015a_bec5_0cba4a3c0b84.description: The multiple choice option's internal ID.

depends_on_object.title: DependsOn
depends_on_object.description: Specifies the text element that provides the default value to the URL slug element. The dependent text element can be part of a content type snippet.

df13aa0a_8d10_0158_3686_a414b4f8abdc.title: id
df13aa0a_8d10_0158_3686_a414b4f8abdc.description: The environment's internal ID. Use this as the `{project_id}` path parameter in project-specific endpoints.

dfa3eb75_e949_017e_117e_ece3f54a4681.title: last_modified
dfa3eb75_e949_017e_117e_ece3f54a4681.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date/time of the last change to the rendition.

dfce1827_93a2_0139_48c3_77ed3cb0fedd.description: A collection of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) used for defining {~allowed_content_types~} in rich text and linked items elements, and {~allowed_elements~} in custom elements.

dfd6b71b_0ce9_0121_e7a4_f6e710353f29.title: op
dfd6b71b_0ce9_0121_e7a4_f6e710353f29.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `addInto` to add new collections
* `move` to change collections' order
* `remove` to delete collections
* `replace` to update collections (e.g., change collection's name)

e0f99e61_7108_0134_fab4_0b16f3dce366.title: global
e0f99e61_7108_0134_fab4_0b16f3dce366.description: Specifies a default value used as the element's initial value across all languages.

e16bdebc_2a03_01f7_8761_0f07d0d2b120.title: id
e16bdebc_2a03_01f7_8761_0f07d0d2b120.description: Unique internal identifier of the content type snippet.

e1cff7e3_af34_015d_afde_fd59d86487d8.title: external_id
e1cff7e3_af34_015d_afde_fd59d86487d8.description:
The content item's external ID. The external ID can be used as a unique identifier to retrieve content from a different system.
External IDs cannot be upserted into exisiting items.

e1d50a61_5d1a_017d_382e_9142bc702ef7.title: last_modified
e1d50a61_5d1a_017d_382e_9142bc702ef7.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last change to the content type.

e3689ec9_0f25_017b_4ac1_a6b54b4a3ce6.title: value
e3689ec9_0f25_017b_4ac1_a6b54b4a3ce6.description: The taxonomy term object you want to add.

e48ff097_e46c_012a_8da7_09db37b91079.title: is_required
e48ff097_e46c_012a_8da7_09db37b91079.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

e64479d8_666f_019c_c942_80cc165374bc.title: global
e64479d8_666f_019c_c942_80cc165374bc.description: Specifies a default value used as the element's initial value across all languages.

e7124f04_e1b7_01ae_150b_fb884c717dff.title: op
e7124f04_e1b7_01ae_150b_fb884c717dff.description: Defines the operation to perform. You can use: `addInto` to add new objects, `remove` to delete objects, or `replace` to modify specific properties.

e742e37a_5b02_0186_c38b_5d19cf40cb7b.title: title
e742e37a_5b02_0186_c38b_5d19cf40cb7b.description: The title of the new asset. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI.

e85d0092_663b_0174_095c_909be79ad30f.title: codename
e85d0092_663b_0174_095c_909be79ad30f.description: The language's codename. Initially generated from the language's `name` unless the language is [added via API](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/51da8af1-3e14-4766-8a3c-b31ae42b0ea6).

e8d14717_b3a3_017c_0a7b_972842725f2b.title: value
e8d14717_b3a3_017c_0a7b_972842725f2b.description:
The object to add. The value depends on the selected `path`:

1. To add a new element, use a [content element](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/97850d2c-d2ec-4750-870a-16bc98271523) object
2. To add a new content group, use a [content group](#section/Content-group-object) object.
3. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to a specific content type.
4. To add an allowed element to a custom element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to the specific element.
5. To add an option to a multiple choice element, use an [option](#section/Multiple-choice-type-element) object.
6. To add an allowed block, text block, or text formatting to a rich text element, use an [array of strings](#section/Rich-text-type-element) to specify its value.

e8e06660_9e51_0143_2fec_011d9061db86.title: maximum_file_size
e8e06660_9e51_0143_2fec_011d9061db86.description: Specifies the maximum file size in bytes.

e93151e4_1e77_01dd_8713_3b5cda3b7deb.title: references
e93151e4_1e77_01dd_8713_3b5cda3b7deb.description: A collection of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) used for defining {~allowed_content_types~} in rich text and linked items elements and {~allowed_elements~} in custom elements.

eafb6453_fb97_0160_15c1_c39c48ead56d.title: op
eafb6453_fb97_0160_15c1_c39c48ead56d.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `replace` to modify taxonomy groups or terms
* `remove` to delete taxonomy terms
* `addInto` to add new taxonomy terms

eb2cda3a_0ebb_0122_f066_ecb290f818ec.title: path
eb2cda3a_0ebb_0122_f066_ecb290f818ec.description:
A string identifying the specific object or property that should be removed. The exact path depends on what you are trying to remove. In each case, a {~{path_reference}~} is needed for the given object.

To remove given objects:

* For an element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}~}.
* For an allowed content type from a rich text or linked items element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the rich text or linked items element and the second is to the allowed content type to be removed.
* For an allowed element from a custom element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_element/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the custom element and the second is to the allowed element to be removed.
* For a multiple choice option, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the multiple choice element and the second is to the option to be removed.

eb9dddda_0da5_0181_ff81_5e6adde394d0.title: codename
eb9dddda_0da5_0181_ff81_5e6adde394d0.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

ebbddd78_8e02_0149_26d0_643bbea31869.title: last_modified
ebbddd78_8e02_0149_26d0_643bbea31869.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date/time of the last change to the folder.

ebc8afd0_e4dd_0137_f7b5_879e74af3421.title: value
ebc8afd0_e4dd_0137_f7b5_879e74af3421.description: The folder object you want to add.

ec4d6bcf_7e1f_0129_dd10_fff70b8b7d16.title: enabled
ec4d6bcf_7e1f_0129_dd10_fff70b8b7d16.description:
Determines if the webhook is enabled. By default, the `enabled` property is set to `true`.

* Enabled webhook reacts to the defined triggers, creates notifications, and tries to send the notifications in order of creation to the specified webhook URL.
* Disabled webhook ignores the defined triggers and does not create any notifications.

ecb351bd_5bfd_0191_60f6_35b9d7c3b5ec.title: op
ecb351bd_5bfd_0191_60f6_35b9d7c3b5ec.description: Defines the operation to perform. You can use: `addInto` to add new objects, `remove` to delete objects, or `replace` to modify specific properties.

ed213db9_fdc8_01f8_f0f2_23cc2157caca.title: value
ed213db9_fdc8_01f8_f0f2_23cc2157caca.description: Specifies the image size or how many times something can be used within the element.

ed354eb0_a013_012f_8f6d_d9f72127df28.title: value
ed354eb0_a013_012f_8f6d_d9f72127df28.description: The value to insert into the property specified in `path` where the format depends on the specific property.

edc10e21_2dfe_01ca_8c31_78e19aaed5db.title: id
edc10e21_2dfe_01ca_8c31_78e19aaed5db.description: The Archived workflow step's internal ID.

ee1026a8_960a_01f6_3ae1_8e61e1ce03c0.title: is_non_localizable
ee1026a8_960a_01f6_3ae1_8e61e1ce03c0.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages. Taxonomy elements cannot be set as non-localizable.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

ee4bcb5b_8c35_012b_f361_bf64d8a07698.title: has_pending_invitation
ee4bcb5b_8c35_012b_f361_bf64d8a07698.description: A flag determining whether the user has any pending invitation to a project.

eec4ca66_fb0e_016e_231d_2f5a7be55583.title: elements
eec4ca66_fb0e_016e_231d_2f5a7be55583.description: An array of asset taxonomy elements.

eef05443_15af_01cc_ea8f_c4a30dd7c150.title: id
eef05443_15af_01cc_ea8f_c4a30dd7c150.description: The Published workflow step's internal ID.

ef833c33_4f0b_0120_7d01_4b82c2e531a7.title: published_step
ef833c33_4f0b_0120_7d01_4b82c2e531a7.description: The workflow's predefined Published workflow step.

efbb5f7d_0596_0119_5096_4ae4de5ab280.title: y
efbb5f7d_0596_0119_5096_4ae4de5ab280.description:
Represents a position on the vertical axis of the original image as the distance from the image's top-left corner in pixels. Combined with the `x` property, the coordinates specify the top-left corner of the source rectangle region defined by `width` and `height`.

The `y`'s maximum value depends on the `height` parameter. The whole rectangle must fit within the borders of the original image.

f0c956e9_d316_01aa_9d2d_95fcb93675c6.title: mode
f0c956e9_d316_01aa_9d2d_95fcb93675c6.description:
Determines the element's mode of operation. * `autogenerated` means the URL slug element sets its value automatically based on the value of a specified text element. * `custom` means the URL slug element's value is not affected by changes in a specified text element and can be set manually.
You can change the text element the URL slug depends on either in the UI or via the API.

f2d34202_f9c7_0148_fd0b_2c9bf0d722da.title: roles
f2d34202_f9c7_0148_fd0b_2c9bf0d722da.description: The roles the user is assigned to in a collection group. At least one role must be specified.

f30fc9ca_25d0_018b_ae27_5ad467bef6f8.title: last_modified
f30fc9ca_25d0_018b_ae27_5ad467bef6f8.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last change to the asset.

f3964398_eda0_010d_fbf6_0ded0b18f670.title: last_modified

[Filter variants by collection](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/7d767512-01a5-4b0f-9aa4-f4dc9a932aa4) to check if the collection is empty first. n0531b65b_a114_011a_72cf_956a1983dcb6.title: value
n0531b65b_a114_011a_72cf_956a1983dcb6.description:
The value of _Linked items_ elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects. Each reference represents a single content item. Every content item can be referenced only once.

When retrieving _Linked items_ elements, the Management API will always reference content items with their internal IDs. When updating _Linked items_ elements via the API, you can reference a content item by its internal ID, codename, or external ID.

n081e7e82_150e_016f_0c98_837c5458515b.title: path
n081e7e82_150e_016f_0c98_837c5458515b.description:
A string identifying the specific object or property that should be removed. The exact path depends on what you are trying to remove. In each case, a `{path_reference}` is needed for the given object.

To remove given objects:

* For an element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}~}.
* For an allowed content type from a rich text or linked items element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the rich text or linked items element and the second is to the allowed content type to be removed.
* For an allowed element from a custom element, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_element/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the custom element and the second is to the allowed element to be removed.
* For a multiple choice option, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/options/{path_reference}~}, where the first {path_reference} is to the multiple choice element and the second is to the option to be removed.
* For a content group, set {~path~} to: {~/content_groups/{path_reference}~}. **Note**: This will also remove all elements contained within the content group.
* For a rich-text element limitation, set {~path~} to: {~/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_blocks/{block}~}, where {block} is the given type of limitation you want to remove.

n08ccd7ac_8dd2_0168_93c9_badd59b6f4d4.title: allowed_image_types
n08ccd7ac_8dd2_0168_93c9_badd59b6f4d4.description:

n214ada0b_0da3_0170_ef8a_b74eeca0ba72.title: collection_groups
n214ada0b_0da3_0170_ef8a_b74eeca0ba72.description:
Specifies the permissions the user has in the project based on the user's [role](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) and access to specific [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/672a109a-bf6c-4498-a244-1b9263682e09) and [languages](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007).

You can assign the user specific roles in different collections. At least one collection group must be specified.

n230b1ba3_58af_010c_cfc1_f3c12c6e71b8.description:

Provide either [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to languages, or an empty array to assign the user to all languages.

Based on the value of {~property_name~}, the {~value~} can be either string or an array of taxonomy terms:

* For a {~property_name~} of {~name~} or {~codename~}, the {~value~} is a string.
* For a {~property_name~} of {~terms~}, the {~value~} is an array of taxonomy term objects.

n309788fe_30a0_0168_ba90_345822d72a60.title: x
n309788fe_30a0_0168_ba90_345822d72a60.description:
Represents a position on the horizontal axis of the original image as the distance from the image's top-left corner in pixels. Combined with the `y` property, the coordinates specify the top-left corner of the source rectangle region defined by `width` and `height`.

The `x`'s maximum value depends on the `width` parameter. The whole rectangle must fit within the borders of the original image.

n31948684_ba11_015c_ce4b_4c236656f12b.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

   * Use `content_item_variant` for the `type`.

   * Use `taxonomy` for the `type`.

n441f1429_2ed1_014b_dbad_e89b7010b9ec.description: Specifies whether the environment has been cloned successfully.

* For {~property_name~} of {~fallback_language~}, the {~value~} property is a [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object.
* For {~property_name~} of {~is_active~}, the {~value~} property is boolean.
