n48efd1d7_e630_01a4_83ff_466a08261071.description: The role's codename. The `codename` property is only applicable for the _Project manager_ role.

n4958e4b7_4559_0159_2c05_4415e70469d0.title: collections
n4958e4b7_4559_0159_2c05_4415e70469d0.description:
Specifies the [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/672a109a-bf6c-4498-a244-1b9263682e09) the user has access to.

Provide either [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to collections, or an empty array to assign the user to all collections.

n496a6833_2452_0114_3d87_52e573e97778.title: elements
n496a6833_2452_0114_3d87_52e573e97778.description: List of elements as defined in the item's [content type](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/09b103e0-7bda-473c-9a26-7b6fe627e74e).

n49f8ca9f_1f43_019c_9d23_07eaa7b6c9ab.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `addInto` to add a new collection
* `move` to change collections' order
* `remove` to delete a collection
* `replace` to update a collection (e.g., change collection's name)

n49fb8525_0f97_015f_dbe0_974620a45700.title: allowed_formatting
n49fb8525_0f97_015f_dbe0_974620a45700.description:
Specifies which text formatting is allowed inside your rich text element. To allow all formatting, leave the array empty. To allow only plaintext, use `["unstyled"]`.
The `unstyled` value must precede any other values in the list.

n4a786a9b_9ce1_012c_a19e_a7b2c1c87af9.title: secret
n4a786a9b_9ce1_012c_a19e_a7b2c1c87af9.description: The webhook's secret key. Use the secret to [verify your webhook](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/5b87f0a1-c271-449d-a9dc-04f995c89589) came from Kontent.ai.

n4afe3755_bed8_012e_5ae4_13d7829b378b.title: before
n4afe3755_bed8_012e_5ae4_13d7829b378b.description:
An _optional_ [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the taxonomy term before which you want to add the new taxonomy term.

For example, to add a term before the existing "Categories" term, you can set {~before~} to {~{codename: categories}~}.

**Note**: The {~before~} and {~after~} properties are mutually exclusive.

n4c07aaaa_5ec2_013b_6267_526bf42f4c35.title: renditions
n4c07aaaa_5ec2_013b_6267_526bf42f4c35.description:
The asset's renditions. [Renditions](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/667fe167-305a-4296-8e50-13a682b1b1f4) are different editions of the original image used in Kontent.
The `renditions` property is optional, but once you specify a rendition for the asset, you need to specify the renditions for all the other referenced assets in the element as well. This is due to the backward compatibility of the API.
When you update a rendition via the API, it gets changed across all assets using this rendition. But when you do the same in the UI, for example, by duplicating an item that contains a rendition, changes to the rendition are not applied across the items. To remove a rendition, leave the array empty.

n4cc2b370_922b_0178_eca3_dd6a5e5a7f4f.title: external_id
n4cc2b370_922b_0178_eca3_dd6a5e5a7f4f.description:
The content group's external ID.
When adding a content type, you must identify the content group by specifying its codename, external ID, or both. In the content elements, you specify a reference to the content group using either the group's codename or external ID.

n4d8e715d_aed9_01b9_96b6_973e6f7bb1d5.title: display_timezone
n4d8e715d_aed9_01b9_96b6_973e6f7bb1d5.description:
[IANA time zone name](https://timezonedb.com/time-zones) used to display time offset of the scheduled unpublish date in the UI.

The time zone doesn't modify the schedule unpublish date specified in the `scheduled_to` property.

If omitted, the scheduled unpublish date will be displayed in a local time zone.

n4df33644_80ee_0138_bb04_c533c908167f.title: issues
n4df33644_80ee_0138_bb04_c533c908167f.description: Information about issues found in specific elements.

n4e1db107_4a0d_0127_bdfd_f1f474fcc07c.title: file_reference
n4e1db107_4a0d_0127_bdfd_f1f474fcc07c.description: Points to a [binary file](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/ce2c4b08-10e7-4497-b1ef-8ceebc606fe0) uploaded to your project. This property is required only when creating an asset. If you update `file_reference`, the asset URL previously copied from [the asset details](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/626c590a-8882-4060-9187-edda6500a25d) may stop working.

n4e9faf4f_3e61_01db_9f27_e935eb69d81e.title: enable_webhooks
n4e9faf4f_3e61_01db_9f27_e935eb69d81e.description:
Determines whether the [webhooks](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/eed8eeb0-cbb1-402f-9484-af805823d8aa) in the specified environment should be enabled after marking the environment as production.

If not specified, the webhooks in the specified environment will be enabled.

n4f2df34a_07ed_01ce_72a1_1ed4f1882e94.title: op
n4f2df34a_07ed_01ce_72a1_1ed4f1882e94.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `replace` to modify taxonomy groups or terms
* `remove` to delete taxonomy terms
* `addInto` to add new taxonomy terms

n4fd775cd_a723_0122_1871_432faff31b3e.title: variant_issues
n4fd775cd_a723_0122_1871_432faff31b3e.description: Report of the problems found in the project's content.

n5073ab12_5ba0_01b8_6efb_5e1b56e90392.title: value
n5073ab12_5ba0_01b8_6efb_5e1b56e90392.description:
The format depends on the custom element you use.

When retrieving and updating custom elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

n518a60ce_5c47_015e_ccfb_05814c9e0cd1.title: maximum_image_size
n518a60ce_5c47_015e_ccfb_05814c9e0cd1.description: Specifies the maximum image size in bytes.

n51a10863_0962_0145_16cf_69a1ec76c8bc.title: after
n51a10863_0962_0145_16cf_69a1ec76c8bc.description:
An _optional_ [reference to the object](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) after which you want to add the new object.

For example, to add a content element or option after an existing element or option named "Text", you can set {~after~} to `{"codename": "snippet_codename__text"}`.

**Note**: The {~before~} and {~after~} parameters are mutually exclusive.

n54556377_c9ce_01e6_1fc5_829e7ea0184d.title: elements
n54556377_c9ce_01e6_1fc5_829e7ea0184d.description:
Elements within the content type.
The order of the Element objects might not match the order in the UI.

examples.name: Content
examples.guidelines: Make it snappy. Rock it like a rocket fuel.

examples.name: URL
examples.guidelines: If needed, provide a custom URL slug.

n54971f53_0a6b_0149_a17f_6d1a4ccafd56.title: create_new_version_role_ids
n54971f53_0a6b_0149_a17f_6d1a4ccafd56.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can [create new versions](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/54caab49-6357-47ac-9895-59c84e07e250) of content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can create new versions.

n54a411f1_5413_0144_a0a2_74f7a9a465e3.title: name
n54a411f1_5413_0144_a0a2_74f7a9a465e3.description: The Published workflow step's display name.

n558606a4_1b27_015b_b50c_7da2a7d8900e.title: role_ids
n558606a4_1b27_015b_b50c_7da2a7d8900e.description: The [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can work with this step, represented by their internal IDs. If empty, all roles can work with this step.

n57135a8e_0e6c_0144_3911_232ef2eb9f55.title: terms
n57135a8e_0e6c_0144_3911_232ef2eb9f55.description:
Any terms nested within this term.
The number of terms which can be set within a taxonomy group is limited to 1000

n57708150_7045_012a_225a_c2fe7196fab8.title: path
n57708150_7045_012a_225a_c2fe7196fab8.description:
A string identifying where the new object or property should be added. The exact path depends on what you are trying to add and where. If you are trying to add a property to a given element, a `{path_reference}` is needed for that element.

1. To add a new element, set `path` to: `/elements`.
2. To add a new content group, set `path` to: `/content_groups`.
3. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_content_types`.
4. To add an allowed element to a custom element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_elements`.
5. To add a new multiple choice option, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/options`.
6. To add a block so it can be used in a rich text element, set `path` to: `/elements/{path_reference}/allowed_blocks`.

n58db91e3_c896_01b0_1663_4fe9ef76f9f8.title: allowed_content_types
n58db91e3_c896_01b0_1663_4fe9ef76f9f8.description: Specifies allowed file types as an array of [references](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the content types.

n5987d314_45fd_01d7_bff7_2824a64299dd.title: collection_groups
n5987d314_45fd_01d7_bff7_2824a64299dd.description: Set of collections user is assigned to with a set of roles.

n59b4c5e6_6364_0197_a0cf_56d71622bd5e.title: custom_height
n59b4c5e6_6364_0197_a0cf_56d71622bd5e.description:
The output image's height in pixels. Must be smaller than `height`.

Use `custom_height` if you want to resize the rectangle region selected via `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height`. That is to keep the contents of the selected rectangle region but make the output image smaller.

n59b8978d_8a7c_015e_fb32_8c87b6d5329f.title: display_timezone
n59b8978d_8a7c_015e_fb32_8c87b6d5329f.description:
[IANA time zone name](https://timezonedb.com/time-zones) used to display time offset of the scheduled publish date in the UI.

The time zone doesn't modify the schedule publish date specified in the `scheduled_to` property.

If omitted, the scheduled publish date will be displayed in a local time zone.

n5b9c4c25_7740_01ff_9f88_ad4e7317eca4.title: value
n5b9c4c25_7740_01ff_9f88_ad4e7317eca4.description: The new name for the folder.

n5baf7878_50e6_015b_b9fa_4dca5ca57025.title: languages
n5baf7878_50e6_015b_b9fa_4dca5ca57025.description: The languages Set of languages user is assigned to within a role. Empty array represents remaining languages not assigned in any other roles.

n5c08a3e2_4c79_01e1_9215_87c50f9917c1.title: before
n5c08a3e2_4c79_01e1_9215_87c50f9917c1.description:
An _optional_ [reference to the object](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) before which you want to add the new object. For example, to add an element or multiple choice option before an existing element or option named "Text", you can set `before` to `{codename: text}`.
The `before` and `after` properties are mutually exclusive.

n5d6da5ab_2eca_0120_c1cf_ac3c648e9db9.title: value
n5d6da5ab_2eca_0120_c1cf_ac3c648e9db9.description: The maximum number of characters or words.

n5da00548_2185_0157_a113_f97db965a39d.title: is_non_localizable
n5da00548_2185_0157_a113_f97db965a39d.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages. Linked items elements cannot be set as non-localizable.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

n5e265e38_609f_0121_7b8f_e87193f9045a.title: scopes
n5e265e38_609f_0121_7b8f_e87193f9045a.description:
Specifies the [content types](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/6eec4ee8-1e14-433c-b35b-39e9d151a377) that this workflow is limited to. If empty, the workflow can be used for any type of content that isn't limited by any other workflow.

Changing the workflow's scope doesn't affect existing content items unless you change their workflow manually.

n5f94492b_e620_017f_20f4_cba2f3b1274a.title: guidelines
n5f94492b_e620_017f_20f4_cba2f3b1274a.description:
Specifies the instructions for contributors on what to insert in the other elements.
The value of the `guidelines` property must follow the same limitations as the value of [rich text elements](#section/Rich-text-element). In addition, the guidelines element cannot contain content items or components.

n60a1c2b8_08f9_013c_7cf6_cd81b1a48904.title: codename
n60a1c2b8_08f9_013c_7cf6_cd81b1a48904.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `id`.

n6131c13a_79c0_01cf_3be0_5f01b9f12eaf.title: is_non_localizable
n6131c13a_79c0_01cf_3be0_5f01b9f12eaf.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

n62b842af_04e0_013a_c7df_b0c4bc96302d.title: guidelines
n62b842af_04e0_013a_c7df_b0c4bc96302d.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.
examples: Always pick colors based on the brand manuals.

n64093537_912d_013e_a28e_23a18321ce02.title: codename
n64093537_912d_013e_a28e_23a18321ce02.description: The element's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the element's `name`.

n655879e0_5fde_01a1_0537_f5b33dd09221.title: fallback_language
n655879e0_5fde_01a1_0537_f5b33dd09221.description: Language to use when the current language contains no content. With multiple languages you can create [fallback chains](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/9e0f560c-5ee4-4649-818a-c5f934b82f4a).

n670fc9a6_f41d_01a6_f07a_12cf369e329b.title: create_new_version_role_ids
n670fc9a6_f41d_01a6_f07a_12cf369e329b.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can [create new versions](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/54caab49-6357-47ac-9895-59c84e07e250) of content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can create new versions.

n6733cc99_e36a_0148_0b37_077304e8c7f5.title: image_height
n6733cc99_e36a_0148_0b37_077304e8c7f5.description: The image's height in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

n694e6b3e_89ed_017e_1503_78cf5c3d83dc.title: last_modified
n694e6b3e_89ed_017e_1503_78cf5c3d83dc.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted date and time of the last content type snippet change.

n6a81e7c4_11ff_01e2_ecc6_02043d74cc2a.title: value
n6a81e7c4_11ff_01e2_ecc6_02043d74cc2a.description:
The object to add. The value depends on the selected `path`: 1. To add a new element, use a [content element](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/97850d2c-d2ec-4750-870a-16bc98271523) object. 2. To add an allowed content type to a rich text or linked items element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to a specific content type. 3. To add an allowed element to a custom element, use a [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) object that points to the specific element with this content type snippet. 4. To add an option to a multiple choice element, use an [option](#section/Multiple-choice-type-element) object. 5. To add an allowed block, text block, or text formatting to a rich text element, use an [array of strings](#section/Rich-text-type-element) to specify its value.
You cannot add a [URL slug element](#section/URL-slug-type-element), [subpages element](#section/Subpages-type-element), or another [content type snippet element](#section/Content-type-snippet-element) as new objects.

n6b2f57e4_6ec4_011c_7262_e18fb30df11b.title: descriptions
n6b2f57e4_6ec4_011c_7262_e18fb30df11b.description: The asset's descriptions for each active language.

examples.description: The asset's alt text for the default language.

n6b345b67_9990_0189_0146_8c86bc07ccc8.title: message
n6b345b67_9990_0189_0146_8c86bc07ccc8.description: The error message explaining what caused the error.
examples: The requested content item 'sample_item' was not found.

n6b819e9b_ec26_01ba_70b6_8c9cfc5aa861.title: reference
n6b819e9b_ec26_01ba_70b6_8c9cfc5aa861.description: [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the folder to be deleted.

n6bc456f1_1676_01aa_8297_f2c08dbbe0b9.title: asset_count_limit
n6bc456f1_1676_01aa_8297_f2c08dbbe0b9.description: Specifies the limitation for the number of assets allowed within the element.

n6e487d20_8a7a_015c_f95b_efcb30332259.title: folders
n6e487d20_8a7a_015c_f95b_efcb30332259.description: Any folders contained within the given folder.

n6e5823ee_eb7b_01d4_8217_5353da8d031a.title: property_name
n6e5823ee_eb7b_01d4_8217_5353da8d031a.description:
The name of the [language](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007) property that you want to modify.

* Use {~name~} to change the display name of the language.
* Use {~codename~} to change the language codename.
* Use {~fallback_language~} to change the fallback language for the specified language.
* Use {~is_active~} to determine whether the language will be set as active.

n72f982ca_a60b_015a_41ed_1f1e91f7dd84.title: reference
n72f982ca_a60b_015a_41ed_1f1e91f7dd84.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the existing taxonomy term that you want to delete.

If you delete a taxonomy term that's being referenced in existing content items (i.e., for [tagging content](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/01fa6fb2-b746-4bb9-92a9-95acd07c6a62)), the items keep references to the deleted taxonomy term. You can find these invalid references in your [project validation report](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/6e744e24-3d5d-4479-9c6d-39895c7d2e06) and remove them.

n7485553f_f31a_010d_38cc_dc2a6c4359c5.title: image_width
n7485553f_f31a_010d_38cc_dc2a6c4359c5.description: The image's width in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

n76614fe6_6bb2_0191_33c7_f783f78831d3.title: external_id
n76614fe6_6bb2_0191_33c7_f783f78831d3.description:
The content type's [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e).
Only present if defined when creating the content type via API.

n76872071_3824_0117_1f99_f5e24a466add.title: is_active
n76872071_3824_0117_1f99_f5e24a466add.description: A flag determining whether the project is active.

n76eeb1c4_c584_0105_c35b_224873674640.title: op
n76eeb1c4_c584_0105_c35b_224873674640.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `addInto` to add new collections
* `move` to change collections' order
* `remove` to delete collections
* `replace` to update collections (e.g., change collection's name)

n77338142_bc3a_01a5_3bc4_2be7f48285fb.description: The element's [reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to a specific content type snippet.

n77e445c1_8c69_0124_b8b8_04ea3ae73a4b.title: id
n77e445c1_8c69_0124_b8b8_04ea3ae73a4b.description: The workflow's internal ID. The ID of the default workflow is always `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000`.

n787e1d67_0143_0140_629b_a3242764c649.title: external_id
n787e1d67_0143_0140_629b_a3242764c649.description: The folder's [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e). Only present if specified when [adding folders](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/c05b6ca5-b5d8-4ef4-85d5-13a0650c2e7d) or [modifying the `folders` array to add new folders](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f9969c9e-2e51-48ca-8c84-2229e2461a5d).

n79231254_d8d1_0186_3864_a2a2f134c804.title: guidelines
n79231254_d8d1_0186_3864_a2a2f134c804.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.
examples: Be sure to be in the correct group

n7a4088c7_c458_01b5_e1de_9a700527ebc5.title: description
n7a4088c7_c458_01b5_e1de_9a700527ebc5.description: Description of the asset for a single language.

n7acc4399_e0b1_01cd_ddc4_8b19e55e4a83.title: codename
n7acc4399_e0b1_01cd_ddc4_8b19e55e4a83.description:
The content group's codename. Unless specified, [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the group's `name`.
When adding a content type, you must identify the content group by specifying its codename, external ID, or both. In the content elements, you specify a reference to the content group using either the group's codename or external ID.

n7be53ba5_b770_01d7_6f3a_e3b5cc3bc508.title: VariantIssue
n7be53ba5_b770_01d7_6f3a_e3b5cc3bc508.description: The {~variant_issues~} attribute is an array of issues found in the content of the project. Each variant issue object contains information necessary to identify the language variant (content item and project language metadata) and lists the content elements.

messages: Element 'Meta description' should have at most 160 characters(s) but has 174 character(s).

n7d5a7cc8_1415_01f5_ae24_8ec1c3222ae9.title: value
n7d5a7cc8_1415_01f5_ae24_8ec1c3222ae9.description: Specifies a date to be used as the element's default value. The date is interpreted as [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated%5FUniversal%5FTime) and stored as an [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted string.

n7de79374_ef9e_01a5_aa41_9c6c328463ba.title: is_active
n7de79374_ef9e_01a5_aa41_9c6c328463ba.description: Determines whether the regex validation for this element is active.

n7e2b17fd_d854_012d_38bf_8d9297e45e96.title: is_required
n7e2b17fd_d854_012d_38bf_8d9297e45e96.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

n804ad6c7_5ac7_0176_60ac_0c6fa4717b2a.title: item_count_limit
n804ad6c7_5ac7_0176_60ac_0c6fa4717b2a.description: Specifies the limitation for the number of items allowed within the element.

n809bfa0d_226d_01a3_91fc_b6fb1bd7749a.title: health_status
n809bfa0d_226d_01a3_91fc_b6fb1bd7749a.description: The webhook's health status tells you whether the webhook is operational. You can use this information for [webhook debugging](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/5b87f0a1-c271-449d-a9dc-04f995c89589).

n809f97b5_948e_019d_ccad_e98e2f048ead.title: image_width_limit
n809f97b5_948e_019d_ccad_e98e2f048ead.description: Specifies the width limitation for images.

n80d406dd_68d2_01f2_ba62_8a0fe64b00db.title: collections
n80d406dd_68d2_01f2_ba62_8a0fe64b00db.description: [References](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to internal identifiers of [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/b6dc92e3-65a7-4a7c-b0e2-69e54b09df2c) that the user is assigned to. If the array is empty, the user can access any collection.

n81e1d9d7_0c93_01a3_7890_789e9afb8093.title: title
n81e1d9d7_0c93_01a3_7890_789e9afb8093.description: The asset's display name. The title can be specified when adding or upserting assets. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI. If not specified, the `title` property is `null`.
examples: Makes the asset easier to find when you need it

n828ace16_5367_0131_4050_d8db9be74479.title: value
n828ace16_5367_0131_4050_d8db9be74479.description:
The value of _Multiple choice_ elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects. Each reference represents one of the multiple choice options, each with a unique identifier.

If the multiple choice element is configured as single option (i.e., radio buttons), its {~value~} array must contain a reference to exactly one option. When configured as multiple option (i.e., checkboxes), the array can contain references to as many options as are defined in the content type. In case no option is selected, the value of the element will be an empty array.

When retrieving _Multiple choice_ elements, the Management API will always reference the multiple choice options with their internal IDs. When updating multiple choice elements via the API, you can reference an option by its internal ID or codename.

n82ea3d58_566f_0195_15f5_66035b46fcbe.title: guidelines
n82ea3d58_566f_0195_15f5_66035b46fcbe.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

n849639f5_c523_014a_6b65_c844004806b4.title: steps
n849639f5_c523_014a_6b65_c844004806b4.description:
The workflow steps in this workflow.
**Prefer codenames over IDs when referring to workflow steps** You can reference existing workflow steps by their codename or ID. We recommend using codenames because it makes your code cleaner and easier to manage. Use ID only when you need to change the codename of a workflow step. If you want to reuse codenames of existing workflow steps in new workflow steps, you need to make two requests. First remove the workflow step with the desired codename. This make the codename available. Then add a new workflow step.

n8644f050_8687_01c9_65d8_91a61fba93b8.title: id
n8644f050_8687_01c9_65d8_91a61fba93b8.description: The Published workflow step's internal ID.

n867ee083_7c62_01fa_e32e_c28460fe0164.title: roles_to_activate
n867ee083_7c62_01fa_e32e_c28460fe0164.description: The [user roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) to activate specified by role ID. These roles will be activated in addition to the users with the _Project manager_ role.

n881c3c96_d38a_01bf_918f_c15228029b1f.title: is_active
n881c3c96_d38a_01bf_918f_c15228029b1f.description: Determines whether the language is active.

n892554c7_a4cd_011d_9a3d_6ba367dab330.title: image_height_limit
n892554c7_a4cd_011d_9a3d_6ba367dab330.description: Specifies the height limitation for images.

n8a370598_56bc_0121_102a_3979b865ecf7.title: unpublish_role_ids
n8a370598_56bc_0121_102a_3979b865ecf7.description: The internal IDs of the [roles](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) that can [unpublish and archive](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/f64599e8-6179-4456-a77c-6716c2e3864b) content items using this workflow. If empty, all roles can unpublish and archive content items.

n8aab6da3_3529_0145_2a48_f816be31af64.title: fit
n8aab6da3_3529_0145_2a48_f816be31af64.description: Controls how the output image is constrained within the provided width and height boundaries after resizing. Only the `clip` [resize fit mode](/learn/reference/image-transformation/#a-resize-fit-mode) is allowed.

n8ad49444_ff3b_011d_e065_67e6c39b4c2d.title: value
n8ad49444_ff3b_011d_e065_67e6c39b4c2d.description: Specifies a number to be used as the element's default value.

n8b1ba2a1_feab_0140_cd22_a3c7510a220d.title: guidelines
n8b1ba2a1_feab_0140_cd22_a3c7510a220d.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.
examples: Select pages to show under this navigation item.

n8d2a4d90_2698_01e5_5974_c91071195397.title: secured_delivery_api_key
n8d2a4d90_2698_01e5_5974_c91071195397.description:
The new environment's Delivery API key for retrieving published content with [secure access](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/312ecd2f-d37f-4055-82c2-ac912d0d4b8d).

Can be `null` if secure access is disabled in the source environment.

n8e3aac81_f85b_01c3_52db_bfd40e83fbed.title: is_required
n8e3aac81_f85b_01c3_52db_bfd40e83fbed.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

n8ef0774e_6331_0126_5e7a_88f8ad3dbf86.title: is_non_localizable
n8ef0774e_6331_0126_5e7a_88f8ad3dbf86.description:
Determines whether the element uses the same value in all languages. Subpages elements cannot be set as non-localizable.
Non-localizable elements are available through early access program and may change in the future. Get familiar with [current limitations](/learn/tutorials/manage-kontent-ai/content-modeling/create-and-delete-content-types/#a-early-access-limitations-for-non-localizable-elements). Contact us and we'll activate non-localizable elements for you.

n905e81ad_2f57_0184_e445_6ac6f99f19e4.title: external_id
n905e81ad_2f57_0184_e445_6ac6f99f19e4.description:
The collection's [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e).
Only present if defined when adding a new collection via API.

n90c8bcff_4caf_01b6_7344_2b1948c6c361.title: components
n90c8bcff_4caf_01b6_7344_2b1948c6c361.description:
A list of [components](#section/Rich-text-element/components-in-rich-text) used in the rich text's `value`.
The components can be nested up to 6 levels deep.

n913c607c_c884_0163_2066_0c4981d925e5.title: value
n913c607c_c884_0163_2066_0c4981d925e5.description:
The value of _Subpages_ elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects. Each reference represents a single content item. Every content item can be referenced only once.

When retrieving _Subpages_ elements, the Management API will always reference content items with their internal IDs. When updating _Subpages_ elements via the API, you can reference a content item by its internal ID, codename, or external ID.

n91615cbc_0421_018a_5d30_bc9ef4151ca3.title: external_id
n91615cbc_0421_018a_5d30_bc9ef4151ca3.description: The rendition's [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e). The value of the `external_id` property must not contain the following characters: `/`, `.`, `;`.

n9162009b_42f5_01e5_4448_d2deb6108da1.title: after
n9162009b_42f5_01e5_4448_d2deb6108da1.description:
[Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to the existing folder after which you want to add the new folder.

**Note**: The `before` and `after` properties are mutually exclusive.

n93f28d96_32c8_017b_09a1_138e17cd49db.title: image_width_limit
n93f28d96_32c8_017b_09a1_138e17cd49db.description: Specifies the width limitation for the asset.

n944635ce_b9bf_0166_e59a_48c1c99b723b.title: value
n944635ce_b9bf_0166_e59a_48c1c99b723b.description:
Time in this element is interpreted as [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated%5FUniversal%5FTime) and stored as an [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO%5F8601) formatted string.

When retrieving and updating Date & time elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

n951cb84f_74f9_0179_a7aa_97a2bafba094.title: op
n951cb84f_74f9_0179_a7aa_97a2bafba094.description:
Specifies the operation to perform.

* `replace` to modify taxonomy groups or terms
* `remove` to delete taxonomy terms
* `addInto` to add new taxonomy terms

n96332b08_d62d_0101_25a4_cb27d839b35c.title: external_id
n96332b08_d62d_0101_25a4_cb27d839b35c.description: The rendition's external ID. The external ID can be specified when adding renditions. If not specified, the `external_id` property is not present.

n9871e007_e873_01eb_84c1_cc08d659cba3.title: elements
n9871e007_e873_01eb_84c1_cc08d659cba3.description:
An array of asset taxonomy elements as defined in the [asset type](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/1867e931-433d-4cf5-b2bb-92555542a4ee).
The asset type can be managed only in the UI. To configure the asset type, you need to have advanced asset management enabled.

n989bde82_64e5_0140_1a8b_f6b4066b9730.title: value
n989bde82_64e5_0140_1a8b_f6b4066b9730.description:
The value of asset elements is an array of [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) objects, each representing a single asset. Every asset can be referenced only once. You can also reference the asset's [renditions](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/667fe167-305a-4296-8e50-13a682b1b1f4) by the `renditions` property. Renditions are specific to images only.

When retrieving asset elements, the Management API will always reference assets with their internal IDs. When updating asset elements via the API, you can reference an asset by its internal ID or external ID. Also, you can reference a rendition by its internal ID or external ID.

n98b52c50_940b_0144_05f4_1538b274e96d.title: validation_message
n98b52c50_940b_0144_05f4_1538b274e96d.description: Specifies a human-friendly message used in validation. Content creators will see the validation message if the value they provide doesn't match the regex pattern.
examples: Type a valid web URL such as https://example.org.

n99619c98_0e62_01f6_6987_408ae6ce89a4.title: guidelines
n99619c98_0e62_01f6_6987_408ae6ce89a4.description: The element's guidelines, providing instructions on what to fill in.

n9a39ad4a_ce3c_01e5_8b03_58cb697af845.title: value
n9a39ad4a_ce3c_01e5_8b03_58cb697af845.description: When retrieving and updating text elements, the format of the {~value~} property will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

n9a3bcecd_0625_0185_434e_c7d83b6e5814.title: allowed_blocks
n9a3bcecd_0625_0185_434e_c7d83b6e5814.description: Specifies which blocks are allowed inside your rich text element. You can allow text, tables, images, and components and items. To allow all blocks, leave the array empty.

n9b8b628f_e7c3_01b4_2717_cf6394f88ace.title: is_required
n9b8b628f_e7c3_01b4_2717_cf6394f88ace.description: Determines whether the element must be filled in.

n9c4d81ad_6e8f_01e3_7e4f_f02df8a57f10.title: width
n9c4d81ad_6e8f_01e3_7e4f_f02df8a57f10.description: Starting at the coordinates defined by `x` and `y`, specifies the width of the rectangle area.

n9ccb8537_8ceb_01d9_7078_ed8c61d04da3.title: global
n9ccb8537_8ceb_01d9_7078_ed8c61d04da3.description: Specifies a default value used as the element's initial value across all languages.

n9f0c31f3_a453_014a_2e2a_0b2f7fcea361.title: terms
n9f0c31f3_a453_014a_2e2a_0b2f7fcea361.description:
All terms in the taxonomy group.
The number of terms which can be set within a taxonomy group is limited to 1000.

n9fec3826_ab27_01e7_b977_f852b50b5e52.title: codename
n9fec3826_ab27_01e7_b977_f852b50b5e52.description: The referenced object's codename. The value of the `codename` property must meet the conditions defined in [rules for codenames](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames).

project_report.title: ProjectReport
project_report.description: A project validity report contains a list of issues found in language variants of all content items. The issues can indicate that either certain content elements reference non-existing objects or contain values that do not meet the limitations set by a content type.

reference.title: Reference
reference.description: [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to a specific object in the project.

reference_without_codename.title: ReferenceWithoutCodename
reference_without_codename.description: [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to a specific object in the project.

reference_without_external_id.title: ReferenceWithoutExternalId
reference_without_external_id.description: [Reference](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) to a specific object in the project.

rendition_transformation_object.title: RenditionTransformation
rendition_transformation_object.description:
Specifies how to transform the original image [asset](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/2b7d6556-7d92-4554-a2df-644af2d77379).

The image area to use for the transformation is determined by the `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height` properties. The `custom_width` and `custom_height` properties set the dimensions of the output image.

The `x` and `y` coordinates define a point in the original image. The point is specified as the distance from the top-left corner of the original image asset in pixels. The whole area must be within the borders of the original image. Upscaling, that is setting the `custom_width` and `custom_height` greater than `width` and `height`, is not allowed.

replace_operation_for_collections.title: CollectionOperationReplace
replace_operation_for_collections.description: To replace a property of a collection.

examples.name: Properties
examples.guidelines: Use only items and components in this element.

taxonomy_group_63e0994.title: TaxonomyGroup
taxonomy_group_63e0994.description: The taxonomy group object contains all information about your taxonomy group, such as its metadata and a collection of its taxonomy terms.

taxonomy_term_78206f4.title: TaxonomyTerm
taxonomy_term_78206f4.description: The taxonomy term object contains metadata about a single taxonomy term and a collection of its descendant taxonomy terms.

untitled_content_item_9a76cee.title: WorkflowObjectProperty
untitled_content_item_9a76cee.description: Specifies the variant's current workflow and workflow step.

untitled_content_item_f840600.title: CollectionGroup
untitled_content_item_f840600.description:
Specifies the permissions the user has in the project based on the user's [role](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3b13de38-2c04-4315-a999-3abd4e2c79b7) and access to specific [collections](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/672a109a-bf6c-4498-a244-1b9263682e09) and [languages](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/03e58bf4-6af1-456c-ad56-ec0a94b07007). 

You can assign the user specific roles in different collections. At least one collection group must be specified.

validation_regex.title: ValidationRegex
validation_regex.description: Specifies a regular expression pattern used to validate the element's value.

webhook.title: Webhook
webhook.description: The webhook object contains all information about a given webhook, including its target URL, secret key for authentication, and a collection of triggers.

asset_identifier_for_upsert.name: asset_identifier
asset_identifier_for_upsert.description:
Identifies an asset by its internal ID (e.g., `fcbb12e6-66a3-4672-85d9-d502d16b8d9c`) or external ID (e.g., `external-id/which-brewing-fits-you`). * When adding a new asset, use an external ID as the asset's identifier. * When updating an existing asset, identify the asset either by its internal ID or external ID.
**New vs existing assets** If the specified external ID is not used by an existing asset, the API will create a new asset. For existing assets, the API updates only the specified asset's descriptions and title.

collection_identifier.name: collection_identifier
collection_identifier.description: Identifies the content collection by its internal ID (e.g., `b7aa4a53-d9b1-48cf-b7a6-ed0b182c4b89`), codename (e.g., `codename/global_collection`), or external ID (e.g., `external-id/my-collection-id`).

content_length.name: Content-length
content_length.description: Specifies the size of the binary file in bytes.

content_type_0c9fd2d.name: Content-type
content_type_0c9fd2d.description: Specifies the [media type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics%5Fof%5FHTTP/MIME%5Ftypes) of the binary data.

file_name.name: file_name
file_name.description:
Specifies the name of the uploaded binary file. The file name specified in the URL will be used for the asset name when you create an asset.

If the name of your file contains [reserved characters](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.2), you need to URL encode the file name first. For instance, use `my%20file%232.png` instead of `my file#2.png`. The file will then show as `my file#2.png` in the Kontent.ai UI.

item_identifier.name: item_identifier
item_identifier.description: Identifies a content item by its internal ID (e.g., `335d17ac-b6ba-4c6a-ae31-23c1193215cb`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/custom-identifier-for-my-article`), or codename (e.g., `codename/my_article`).

item_identifier_for_upsert.name: item_identifier
item_identifier_for_upsert.description:
Identifies a content item by its internal ID (e.g., `335d17ac-b6ba-4c6a-ae31-23c1193215cb`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/custom-identifier-for-my-article`), or codename (e.g., `codename/my_article`). * To create a content item, you need to specify the [external ID](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/39ee23e8-c352-4966-b48d-7b312da3100e) as the item's identifier. * To update a content item, identify the existing item by its internal ID, external ID, or codename.
**External IDs** If the provided external ID is not used by an existing content item, the API will try to create a new item. If the content item specified by the external ID already exists, the properties specified in the request body will be updated.

language_identifier_for_languages.name: language_identifier
language_identifier_for_languages.description: Identifies the language by its internal ID (e.g., `2ea66788-d3b8-5ff5-b37e-258502e4fd5d`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/standard-german`), or codename (e.g., `codename/de-DE`).

language_identifier_for_variants.name: language_identifier
language_identifier_for_variants.description: Identifies the language by its internal ID (e.g., `d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8`) or codename (e.g., `codename/es-ES`).

project_id.name: project_id
project_id.description:
Identifies your project.

If you're using [environments](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/a814879f-64a2-4689-8a99-e4e98cdf60ba), the project ID becomes environment ID and specifies one of the project's environments.

rendition_identifier.name: rendition_identifier
rendition_identifier.description: Identifies a rendition by its internal ID (e.g., `ce559491-0fc1-494b-96f3-244bc095de57`) or external ID (e.g., `external-id/hero-image-rendition`).

role_identifier.name: role_identifier
role_identifier.description: Identifies the role by its internal ID (e.g., `7dedb656-aef7-40ae-8158-98bbf3542f4a`), or codename (e.g., `codename/project-manager`).

snippet_identifier.name: snippet_identifier
snippet_identifier.description: Identifies a specific content type snippet by its internal ID (e.g., `baf884be-531f-441f-ae88-64205efdd0f6`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/snippet-type-123`), or codename (e.g., `codename/metadata`).

taxonomy_group_identifier.name: taxonomy_group_identifier
taxonomy_group_identifier.description: The identifier of a specific [taxonomy group](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/37f45a13-9d90-4a38-aba7-5c28758647a3). You can specify a taxonomy group by its internal ID (e.g., `0be13600-e57c-577d-8108-c8d860330985`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/Tax-Group-123`), or codename {e.g., `codename/personas`).

type_identifier.name: type_identifier
type_identifier.description: Identifies the content type by internal ID (e.g., `269202ad-1d9d-47fd-b3e8-bdb05b3e3cf0`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/Content-Type-123`), or codename (e.g., `codename/hosted_video`).

user_identifier.name: user_identifier
user_identifier.description: Identifies the user by their internal ID (e.g., `mB9I0b-n-Zhe-x2my4NPjJovOiE0cqKgIyuVjqfKyW0`) or email (e.g., `email/user@example.com`).

webhook_identifier.name: webhook_identifier
webhook_identifier.description: Identifies a specific [webhook](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/eed8eeb0-cbb1-402f-9484-af805823d8aa) by its internal ID (e.g., `5df74e27-1213-484e-b9ae-bcbe90bd5990`).

workflow_identifier.name: workflow_identifier
workflow_identifier.description: Identifies the workflow by its internal ID (e.g., `8bfdb62d-7aa1-473b-9d80-311ef93db108`) or codename (e.g., `codename/my-workflow`).

workflow_step_identifier.name: workflow_step_identifier
workflow_step_identifier.description: Identifies the workflow step by its internal ID (e.g., `13145328-b946-4e47-9c9d-6f40c7aaeaef`) or codename (e.g., `codename/draft`).

x_continuation_4a04ea9.name: x-continuation
x_continuation_4a04ea9.description:
Determines the page of results to retrieve.

To get the next page of results, check the pagination object in the API response and set the `x-continuation` header parameter to the value of the `continuation_token` property.

Bearer.description:
This API uses OAuth 2.0 [bearer token](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6750) (API key) to authorize requests. Requests with an incorrect or missing `Authorization` header will fail with an [error](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/62b06ae7-bac5-4d37-be97-efa30f879dd1).

You can authenticate Management API v2 requests using one of two types of keys:

* Management API key, accepted by all project-specific endpoints (all endpoints except from [Subscription](https://learn-web-live-dev.azurewebsites.net/learn/link-to/id/3380fb20-d3f3-4f03-a09a-f0b495a38785)).
* Subscription API key, accepted by all endpoints.
